page.title: 07Transport around Harberton
page.content: Most people feel that a car is essential especially those in outlying areas. Car ownership has lead to a decline in public transport services which are now inadequate.Over the last ten years the bus service has declined from several buses a day to two a week (apart from the daily school buses to Totnes and Harbertonford during school terms). A community bus service has been instigated recently, and taxis are used regularly by villagers as a flexible alternative to public transport. Many people could not live in the area if they did not have acess to a car - some families have two cars. The nearest town Totnes is on the main railway line from the West Country to London.
